item.title: Initial Setup & Installation
item.description:
Host Environment Setup (from a Blank System) link

Assumption: You are starting from a fresh Ubuntu 24.10 (amd64) install with no extra packages.

1. Update System link

 sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y

2. Install Essential Packages link

Install all required tools for virtualization, development, and Node.js:

 sudo apt install -y qemu-kvm libvirt-daemon-system libvirt-clients bridge-utils build-essential linux-headers-$(uname -r) curl git nodejs npm

Tip: If you get an error about missing kernel headers, ensure your kernel version matches the installed headers. Use uname -r and apt search linux-headers to check.

item.title: Attacking VM Setup
item.description:
Follow these steps once the host environment is ready and the VMs have been created or downloaded.

Usage link

  1. Ensure the attacker.qcow2 disk is in the vm/ directory (verify via ./scripts/check_vms.sh or see VM Installation & Verification).
  2. Launch the attacking VM with: 
     sudo ./scripts/run_vms.sh attacker
    Or both VMs with: 
     sudo ./scripts/run_vms.sh
  3. On the attacking VM:
    • Auto-login is enabled for user attacker (no password prompt).
    • The static IP is 192.168.200.11.
    • The password is jules.

For more details on the network configuration and helper scripts, see Initial Setup & Installation.

item.title: Victim VM Setup
item.description:
Follow these steps once the host environment is ready and the VMs have been created or downloaded.

  1. Place the victim.qcow2 disk in the vm/ directory at the project root (verify via ./scripts/check_vms.sh or see VM Installation & Verification).

  2. Launch the victim VM with:

     sudo ./scripts/run_vms.sh victim

    Or both VMs with:

     sudo ./scripts/run_vms.sh

  3. On the victim VM:

    • The VM has auto-login enabled for the victim user (no password prompt).
    • Its static IP is 192.168.200.10.
    • The password is jules.

  4. When finished, close the QEMU window or use Ctrl+C on the host script to shut down both VMs.
